TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
Here's my latest beastie the MK3 Cargo <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>.  
  
She hauls 2 Jumbo tanks to <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>. Super easy to fly. Fully functional with <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr>, docking port, extra lights, etc... No mods or cheaty clipping or anything like that.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QZq_ZKgqtS8?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

Something a bit different from me, a heavy cargo <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>.

It can put nearly 324 tons into <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>, and has a payload fraction around 37.5

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Dqopy9UyDYk?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

Decided to finally re-fly a project I did a lot of work on back in 1.0.5.

I present a unique entry: the [AS-3A Skystreak](https://kerbalx.com/Box_of_Stardust/AS-3A-Skystreak). This <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> can be built with only a Tier 2 R&D facility, and it also doesn't require the High Altitude Flight node (but may fly more optimally with parts from it). It has an incredibly tight error margin on the ascent profile, and it doesn't get to orbit with that much <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr>, but it gets up there. With a good ascent, it has enough <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr> to do part retrieval missions in an unconventional manner, and was the primary objective behind designing this <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>- do part retrieval missions cheaply, instead of sending a rocket with stages that have to be expended or recovered, which cuts into the profit margin.

>

**Edited <time datetime="2018-04-02T02:51:12Z" title="04/02/2018 02:51  AM" data-short="6 yr">April 2, 2018</time> by Box of Stardust**

The Griffon Mark II, my second try at an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, and my first successful ever. It is capable of lifting 1-2 Tonnes into <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> size permitting, it is capable of being re-fit depending on how much cargo space you need, granted it is riding the limits of its fuel, so lengthening it is more viable. I refueled it using <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> and <abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>, and is alot of fun to handle.

![Takeoff](https://i.imgur.com/1ztgamv.jpg)![Orbiting](https://i.imgur.com/tHTffN1.jpg)![Payload Deployment](https://i.imgur.com/dHVxP3N.jpg)![Payload Deployment 2](https://i.imgur.com/91Up38S.jpg)![Payload Deployment 3](https://i.imgur.com/l4lSb1d.jpg)![Sunshine](https://i.imgur.com/EGKzewu.png)**![Re-Entry](https://i.imgur.com/fZ1NHc8.png)![Re-Entry Forward](https://i.imgur.com/YZDhdco.jpg)![Returning to Base](https://i.imgur.com/bzVRQN3.jpg)![Over-City](https://i.imgur.com/FLYOnXh.jpg)![Final Approach](https://i.imgur.com/R6ZlHDA.jpg)![Final Approach 2](https://i.imgur.com/jcVZTz6.jpg)** **![Touchdown and Taxiing to Refuel](https://i.imgur.com/1hQOmlz.jpg)![Pre-Linking](https://i.imgur.com/omHRCgm.jpg)![Post-Linking](https://i.imgur.com/IckvJje.jpg)![Refueling](https://i.imgur.com/ti1Xm3h.jpg)![Refueling Complete](https://i.imgur.com/wQFzCkC.jpg)![Ready for Re-flight!](https://i.imgur.com/QuWSDMW.jpg)**

That looks like a well developed <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

However, be careful in making an even longerer version - the length parts add some weight which has fuel implications, and then it will also throw off the <abbr title="Center of Mass">COM</abbr>/<abbr title="Center of Lift">COL</abbr> balance, so you will have to spend some time to reposition the wing, and then that can have knock on effects for handling, especially when you come down....... And in the end you will end up with a completely new design!

It is very hard to make variants that work!

And in the end you will end up with a completely new design!

I agree, which is why I would, rather instead of adding moar fuel, just try and design a new one that works with heavier and bigger payloads. As the saying goes, 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it.'

>

> 
> 
> It probably helps that I have alot of experience designing aircraft in KSP. Not only can I make them visually pleasing, but functional too! lol.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I agree, which is why I would, rather instead of adding moar fuel, just try and design a new one that works with heavier and bigger payloads. As the saying goes, 'If it ain't broke, don't fix it.'
> 

I agree it looks great! I am not so good at making good looking planes. I tend to just go for the most pointy nose I can find and then it is all about functionality!

I see it can be used unmanned as it has a probe core, have you considered scrapping the cockpit and adding fuel tanks in it's place?

Will you be putting this onto KerbalX for people to download and play with?

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, Andetch said:
> 
> 
> I see it can be used unmanned as it has a probe core, have you considered scrapping the cockpit and adding fuel tanks in it's place?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Will you be putting this onto KerbalX for people to download and play with?
> 

That isnt a bad Idea! I put it there so it had electric charge for the mission, but I never thought to use it for actual control, lol, will definetily try it and see if I can get better fuel margins from it! Griffon Mark II/Q!

I am doing that as we speak ;P

The cockpit also has reaction wheels - I don't think the probe core has so much reaction wheel control. What I would do is instead of the cockpit, add a long pointy shaped fuel tank, then a reaction wheel, then a tail piece, turned around, so then it has a really long pointed nose..... Oh, and I would also adjust the wing position to account for the new weight distribution, and possible adjust the flow priorities so the fuel in the nose drains slower, keeping the <abbr title="Center of Mass">COM</abbr> from moving so rapidly.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-04-02T10:55:37Z" title="04/02/2018 10:55  AM" data-short="6 yr">April 2, 2018</time> by Andetch**

What I would do is instead of the cockpit, add a long pointy shaped fuel tank, then a reaction wheel, then a tail piece, turned around, so then it has a really long point nose..... Oh, and I would also adjust the wing position to account for the new weight distribution, and possible adjust the flow priorities so the fuel in the nose drains slower, keeping the <abbr title="Center of Mass">COM</abbr> from moving so rapidly.
> 

That sounds tricky but fuel flow seems simple enough. the higher the number the slower it drains and all. I'll see what I can do. SSTOs are a nice new thing to try out and I'm glad I may have a knack for them.

> 
> 
> 14 minutes ago, Andetch said:
> 
> 
> The cockpit also has reaction wheels - I don't think the probe core has so much reaction wheel control. What I would do is instead of the cockpit, add a long pointy shaped fuel tank, then a reaction wheel, then a tail piece, turned around, so then it has a really long point nose..... Oh, and I would also adjust the wing position to account for the new weight distribution, and possible adjust the flow priorities so the fuel in the nose drains slower, keeping the <abbr title="Center of Mass">COM</abbr> from moving so rapidly.
> 

With <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> it is all about having the <abbr title="Center of Mass">COM</abbr> and <abbr title="Center of Lift">COL</abbr> aligned properly so you don't spin out coming back empty.

It is something a lot of people miss.

We saw, we liked.... We copied...... Not landed it yet as I don't have time - but I will later! Need to adjust the amount of <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/O it carried as I took a whole load of oxidizer to orbit with me that I can't use! And I am having imgur issues and it wont let me upload all the pictures.. ![NOWRNre.png](https://i.imgur.com/NOWRNre.png)

![UAGVNeh.png](https://i.imgur.com/UAGVNeh.png)![MO1iaVe.png](https://i.imgur.com/MO1iaVe.png)

[@Andetch](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/173643-andetch/) I have the KerbalX uploads!

[https://kerbalx.com/BitRefresh/Griffon-Mark-II-Q](https://kerbalx.com/BitRefresh/Griffon-Mark-II-Q)

[https://kerbalx.com/BitRefresh/Griffon-Mark-II](https://kerbalx.com/BitRefresh/Griffon-Mark-II)

I have a family of Mk 2 SSTOs I haven't posted anywhere yet.  The variants are the Pup C with a small Mk 2 cargo bay and an inline docking port, the Pup P with the cargo bay replaced with a passenger cabin, and the Pup XC with no docking port and the long cargo bay.  I will post pics and links when I get home.

So it turns out my ascent profile on my AS-3A Skystreak was just junk and overly complicated. With a much more straightforward, flat ascent, building up speed through the atmo instead of climbing high to do it, 3A Skystreak can achieve around 300m/s combined <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr> in orbit, which is plenty enough to do some rendezvous and stuff. I have a 3B version which uses High Altitude Flight research node parts and LV-T45s which can achieve at least 500m/s combined <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr> in orbit, or potentially carry a light payload. Not bad for a Tier 2 R&D <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>.

![imXTEoi.png](https://i.imgur.com/imXTEoi.png)

Congratulations to ...

[@XLjedi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/175658-xljedi/) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with SR-13 Venom.

[@g00bd0g](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/74045-g00bd0g/) - Utilitarial Commendation (72t), Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Mk3 Cargo.

[@JacobJHC](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/152333-jacobjhc/) - Utilitarial Commendation (324t), Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Heavy Cargo <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>.

[@Box of Stardust](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/112527-box-of-stardust/) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with AS-3A Skystreak.

... for successfully completing the K-Prize mission. Well flown all, thankyou for your mission reports and welcome to the K-Prize Party guest list aka the roll of honour. 

It will be interesting to see the promised mission reports when your craft have landed safely [@Thor Wotansen](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/157596-thor-wotansen/)

**Edited <time datetime="2018-04-08T08:27:14Z" title="04/08/2018 08:27  AM" data-short="6 yr">April 8, 2018</time> by boolybooly**

Rebuilt one of my STS shuttles to function as an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, just to bump the thread ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/6jbYh6evutY?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

Thanks for your interest and mission report [@hoioh](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/118116-hoioh/) 

Is this intended as a gate crasher? ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

Please correct me if I am wrong but apart from the not insignificant matter of an exploding airbrake isnt your sturdy and useful looking ship using modified parts?

If so I must draw your attention to rule 3 and the K-Prize sister thread for modded missions.

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> 3. All fuel tanks, wings (ie lift generators & aerodynamic environments) and engine parts must be stock, for fairness.
> 

[https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/168274-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back-modded-version/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/168274-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back-modded-version/)

The reason I think it is using modded parts is the onscreen text in a dialogue box which indicates the presence of a SpaceY mod thrustplate as part of the engine array, as revealed in the blocking notice for the NearFutureSolar blanket PV array... also the cargo capsule is non stock, as all stock cargos have swing doors and this part is significant because it contributes to aerodynamics. Also I dont recognise the main wings as stock though its hard to tell with the part colouring mods available. 

Besides this the exploding airbrake, which sent the craft into a potentially disastrous spin from which it was skillfully recovered by the pilot, unfortunately breaks rule 1. 

So while I am grateful for your kindness in bumping the thread, I believe the mission should be linked as a Gatecrasher. Alternatively would you like some time to complete a stock mission successfully and expunge the Gatecrasher listing? Or would you prefer to join the ranks of infamy!? If you want to do a stock mission then I will delay until you are ready.![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

**Edited <time datetime="2018-04-28T08:52:12Z" title="04/28/2018 08:52  AM" data-short="6 yr">April 28, 2018</time> by boolybooly**

[@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) I would be happy to join the party as a gatecrasher as the submission was obviously intended to crash a couple of gates! ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

I was not under any impression that this submission conformed to just about any of the rules of the challenge other than taking off from the runway and landing right back onto it just for fun and to show how simple an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> can be when built properly.

I did lose the airbrake (this was my third attempt and I could be less stressed for not losing any significant part, like a wing or some such) and apart from the airbrake and maybe the landing gear just about all of the parts are non-stock or modified in some way by means of tweakscale annd the like.

In the interest of fairness I will be submitting a proper "by the books" <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> for your (re)viewing pleasure just for the sake of it in the 'near future' ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

Now that the gate has been crashed it is time to make an entrance ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Uf-WD_FFRgI?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

Thankyou for your second (in this version) mission report [@hoioh](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/118116-hoioh/) 

You have earned both a K-Prize listing and a Gatecrasher's quip. As you may know you are entitled to display either, neither or both badges as you require and to request the removal of the Gatecrasher listing if you so wish (I just thought you might like to have both). I made up a name for your stock ship but will replace it with any you care to specify.

So in the time honored tradition ... congratulations on completing the K-Prize mission successfully with the additional accomplishment of hauling a space lab into orbit and returning to land safely on the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway. Welcome back to the K-Prize party guest list aka the roll of honour.

[hoioh](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3366481) Utilitarial Commendation, Advanced Pilot Precision Award with By\_The\_Book.

And here for the record is the Gatecrasher quip.

[hoioh](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3363517) suggested there was no such thing as bad publicity.﻿﻿﻿ 

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Thank you [@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) for the apt naming of my shuttle, I think I will christen the other one the "By\_The\_Back\_of\_a\_Beer\_Coaster" for the sake of completionism ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

I will proudly wear the Gatecrasher badge alongside the official one

My latest try at a high <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr> shuttle: over 4800 <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr> in <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>

[https://imgur.com/gallery/4LwaAdO](https://imgur.com/gallery/4LwaAdO)

Slow but steady. Takeoff is best described as "gentle".

![zjRpeEN.png](https://i.imgur.com/zjRpeEN.png)

4924kv in <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>

![229Q4fU.png](https://i.imgur.com/229Q4fU.png)

For all I ask is a tall ship, and a star to sail her by.

![Fo8eGJV.png](https://i.imgur.com/Fo8eGJV.png)

Ship holds position quite well for bleeding off speed.

![KFmawRb.png](https://i.imgur.com/KFmawRb.png)

Landing is similarly as gentle as takeoff.

![BtUfNqL.png](https://i.imgur.com/BtUfNqL.png)

And we're back - with more than half our fuel.

![sEFxzju.png](https://i.imgur.com/sEFxzju.png)

Congratulations [@beomagi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/168393-beomagi/) on completing the K-Prize mission successfully and returning to land with great precision on the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway for which feat of daring do the K-Prize committee (me) awards the highly regarded Advanced Pilot Precision Award.

Thankyou for your mission report and welcome to the K-Prize party guest list aka the roll of honour.

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Thanks Booly ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") Decided to roll another craft, trying to push the <abbr title="Delta-V">DV</abbr> higher.

This space plane has nearly 6000dv after getting to <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>. So I visit every station I've made in Kerbin's influence with a dock.

I dock with 5 stations and land on minmus without refueling. 

[https://imgur.com/gallery/YGaB6BS](https://imgur.com/gallery/YGaB6BS)

Spoiler

Images resized to 500px wide to keep it easier on DL - or just use link below.

[https://imgur.com/gallery/YGaB6BS](https://imgur.com/gallery/YGaB6BS)

![mDNchCw.png](https://i.imgur.com/mDNchCw.png)

The Journey begins quite slowly. 380m/s on passing the island. An easy benchmark for spaceplanes. This one will be sluggish, but the 4 oxidizer tanks will let the rapiers give enough push later for the nuke engine to finish off orbital insertion.

![nTOFSmi.png](https://i.imgur.com/nTOFSmi.png)

At about 1400m/s between 10k/11k altitude, I switch on the nuclear engine. not much acceleration, but it helps keep speed up while i angle up between 10-15 degrees.

![WFFynqV.png](https://i.imgur.com/WFFynqV.png)

At ~29km altitude, the rapiers kick into closed cycle mode, and get pretty close to orbit. the nuclear engine only has to put out ~300dv more.

![Qsw5G7m.png](https://i.imgur.com/Qsw5G7m.png)

At just shy of 6k <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr>, i may as well visit a few places. First up is an probe i did a few versions ago - "Mega Station III"

![o5ReK2Y.png](https://i.imgur.com/o5ReK2Y.png)

Setting up rendezvous...

![jieIwyy.png](https://i.imgur.com/jieIwyy.png)

Almost there, alternating burning retrograde and at target a couple times.

![e7MnXj1.png](https://i.imgur.com/e7MnXj1.png)

At the first station. Getting out or kerbin's gravity well is always a bit punishing. I didn't use the most efficient burn for rendezvous, so 1600dv later...

![6iOvUa2.png](https://i.imgur.com/6iOvUa2.png)

Docked! As large and convoluted as this seems, it's nothing compared to the last station on the list. Jeb inspects the station and science team. The team feasts on mun cake and minmus cream. Considering the station in tip top shape, Jeb tearfully departs.

![t5cy4ki.png](https://i.imgur.com/t5cy4ki.png)

Next up is Moon Base Alpaca. Jeb does a flyby of the Mun.

![wUrDfi3.png](https://i.imgur.com/wUrDfi3.png)

And squeezes into orbit. A short bit of plotting later, Moon Base Alpaca at the intercept!

![nsEUgPl.png](https://i.imgur.com/nsEUgPl.png)

Pulling up to Moon Base Alpaca. This was a station created to fulfill a contract. Long since abandoned. Still has mid-stage thrusters and fuel. Last nuke stage was untouched. Maybe it should head to another system...

![BH0Pc6C.png](https://i.imgur.com/BH0Pc6C.png)

Docked! Note to self - angled docking ports are a pain.  
![9TiOon4.png](https://i.imgur.com/9TiOon4.png)

Mimus is next. Once clear of the moon, <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr> requirements really fall quickly.  
![1OwqB1K.png](https://i.imgur.com/1OwqB1K.png)

Insertion and minor piloting to the Minmus ore miner.  
![DQHqg9B.png](https://i.imgur.com/DQHqg9B.png)

Ore miner overhead. Not a large station, but several s4 tanks make it a useful stop for refueling.  
![P0DSB5j.png](https://i.imgur.com/P0DSB5j.png)

Easy does it... not as easy without <abbr title="Reaction Control System">rcs</abbr>.  
![5rdbvME.png](https://i.imgur.com/5rdbvME.png)

And Docked! Jeb inspects the miner. It's in working order. No fuel was taken, since there's simply no need.

![fJB0n5N.png](https://i.imgur.com/fJB0n5N.png)

Jeb does a little space work to earn his inspector's gig.  
![A7u2Ryk.png](https://i.imgur.com/A7u2Ryk.png)

![7TqE0e1.png](https://i.imgur.com/7TqE0e1.png)

Next up is another contract base, creatively named "base mun" base mun's orbit is shockingly low with a periapsis under 5800m.

![syDjQQB.png](https://i.imgur.com/syDjQQB.png)

It's jolting seeing the ground up this close while docking.  
![U1G5202.png](https://i.imgur.com/U1G5202.png)

Took several tries to dock. When i finally did, Jeb's jostling of the station had knocked the orbit's periapsis to just over 3000. Jeb decided the low orbit was a little too dangerous, even if it was damned cool to see mountain peaks almost upon the craft. A proficient pilot, he activated only the 2 engines in line with the docked craft, with the one farthest from it at 40% thrust for balance.

![ZEBMcbr.png](https://i.imgur.com/ZEBMcbr.png)

Jeb left the station at a 12k circular orbit. Glancing at the tiny moon, he figured, "why not"?

![yZABjUo.png](https://i.imgur.com/yZABjUo.png)

May as well visit minmus for the secret ingredients to "Minmus cream".

![FGBpHQL.png](https://i.imgur.com/FGBpHQL.png)

Landed, and watching the station he just left passing overhead.

![KhyWUin.png](https://i.imgur.com/KhyWUin.png)

Takeoff from the flat areas in a "light" spaceplane isn't bad. Retracting/extending the forward landing gear kicks up the nose a little. With the light Minmus gravity, the nuke engine easily pushes the ship to orbit.

![VPk1jp3.png](https://i.imgur.com/VPk1jp3.png)

Almost 3k <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr> left, time to head back to Kerbin for our last visit. An asteroid base in polar orbit.

![26m5gyG.png](https://i.imgur.com/26m5gyG.png)

Jeb came in from above minmus, which put him on the wrong orbital direction. close to 3000m/s at periapsis, 50m/s at apoapsis. Not an expensive error.

![RyRM3hI.png](https://i.imgur.com/RyRM3hI.png)

Jeb gets into Polar orbit, and works on the minor inclination. Next up is setting up a rendezvous.

![VjmT8em.png](https://i.imgur.com/VjmT8em.png)

Even small changes around Kerbin add up.

![DVTX15q.png](https://i.imgur.com/DVTX15q.png)

But he makes it. A dual base asteroid. This was made long long ago, before autostrut. Thankfully the Kraken hasn't disintegrated it.

![6vuQpPL.png](https://i.imgur.com/6vuQpPL.png)

Frame rate is punished under the load! Almost ignored docking here.

![Zqc09VN.png](https://i.imgur.com/Zqc09VN.png)

Jeb still manages to dock. The larger of the stations was sent up here with a few emergency escape crafts. We can see there's one left for scientists to exist the station, with enough <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr> and a lander to get to Kerbin.  
![7Dzn58m.png](https://i.imgur.com/7Dzn58m.png)

Say cheese Jeb! That is one crazy looking amalgam...

![vrSQKbo.png](https://i.imgur.com/vrSQKbo.png)

His mind back on the job, Jeb goes back to inspecting the station. This was a good opportunity to autostrut as much of these stations as possible. On docking, the stations were swaying. That stopped after most parts were autostrut, so hopefully future krakens were put to rest.

![rHl5Siq.png](https://i.imgur.com/rHl5Siq.png)

Even spacewalks around this monstrosity are tough with the frame rate hit. Jeb takes a look at Kerbin, knowing the last part of his journey is probably the most dangerous.

![N7WWopU.png](https://i.imgur.com/N7WWopU.png)

Final beauty shot!

![GgW567q.png](https://i.imgur.com/GgW567q.png)

Time to land. Jeb will be coming in with an effective crosswind. First part of doing this safely is to transition to <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>.

![QnTGF9z.png](https://i.imgur.com/QnTGF9z.png)

Close enough Jeb.

![ARuok4b.png](https://i.imgur.com/ARuok4b.png)

Jeb waits a little for the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> to get along his path. Once there, a little retrograde sets his little craft up for home. not much fuel is left.

![1BfAl8o.png](https://i.imgur.com/1BfAl8o.png)

Jeb's curious how the air braking will work here. Effective air speed is higher coming in polar.

![iPLV0v0.png](https://i.imgur.com/iPLV0v0.png)

Land ho! Jeb angles the craft to get lined up with the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> and maintain altitude.

![TGtBJ53.png](https://i.imgur.com/TGtBJ53.png)

93KM from the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>. Jeb can taste home!

![rbfjOAi.png](https://i.imgur.com/rbfjOAi.png)

Most of the speed bled off, but at this altitude we don't need a drop of fuel  to do a nice gentle turn, and land.

![H7ok5Cp.png](https://i.imgur.com/H7ok5Cp.png)

LANDED! No fuel was needed from the retrograde burn that put Jeb on the path the the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> - which is good because we had almost none left.

<abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr> diary!

5944 - in orbit  

4336 - first station intercept point  

4095 - second station (Mun orbit) intercept point  

3804 - third station (Minmus orbit) intercept point  

3698 - fourth staion (second Minmus orbit station) intercept point  

3450 - landed on Minmus  

2405 - polar orbit of Kerbin  

1901 - fifth station visit intercept point  

1053 - <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>  

883  - setup approach to land
